creator: dave@daveboden.com
text:
Created attachment 27304
Patch file

I've got Chainsaw v2 working connecting to Tibco EMS (JMS) and receiving log updates. To do so, I needed to enter a password to connect to the Tibco EMS server.

JMSReceiverBeanInfo currently doesn't let you specify a password, so you don't get the password entry box on the GUI. A small change gets things working.

(I've also moved the pom.xml file over from 1.1-SNAPSHOT to 1.1 of the apache-log4j-component artifact now that 1.1 has been built and seems to have everything required. I only tend to point at snapshots when required, preferring to point at release versions when there's nothing new in the snapshot that's needed or desirable.

creator: dave@daveboden.com
text:
Created attachment 27305
Shows the new password text entry box on Chainsaw V2.

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text:
It seems we should also add the support for the 'promptForUserInfo' parameter, and make this a 'visual receiver' so the receiver can provide a gui dialog prompting for username and password if this is set, for those who don't want to embed a password in the configuration file.

I can look into adding this.

creator: dave@daveboden.com
text:
If time allows, I might consider adding a JMS Implementation classpath as an additional setting. By specifying the location of the Tibco EMS, Active MQ or other implementation jar(s), I can avoid hacking the chainsaw.bat file altogether. At the moment, I have to add the Tibco EMS tibems.jar onto the startup classpath.

This would only work on Java WebStart if the package is signed.

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text: In chainsaw, there is a plugin classpath - $userhome/.chainsaw/plugins - you may be able to add your jar there and have it just 'work' (remove the security manager in general prefs just to make sure it's ok).
